attributes.title: American Masters
attributes.description_short: Discover insightful profiles of important figures in America's artistic and cultural life.
attributes.description_long: American Masters, committed to producing comprehensive film biographies about the broad cast of characters who comprise our cultural history.
attributes.funder_message: Major support for American Masters is provided by AARP. Additional funding is provided by Rosalind P. Walter, The Philip and Janice Levin Foundation, Judith and Burton Resnick, Ellen and James S. Marcus, Lillian Goldman Programming Endowment, The Blanche & Irving Laurie Foundation, Vital Projects Fund, Cheryl and Philip Milstein Family, The André and Elizabeth Kertész Foundation, Lenore Hecht Foundation, Michael & Helen Schaffer Foundation, and public television viewers.

attributes.title: I.M. Pei In Memoriam
attributes.description_short: We mourn the loss of renowned architect I.M. Pei.
attributes.description_long: We mourn the loss of renowned architect I.M. Pei, subject of an American Masters documentary in 2010. In this clip from American Masters—Alexander Calder¸ Pei discusses sculpture’s evolving relationship to architecture, and his initial reaction to Michelangelo’s David.

attributes.title: Remembering Tim Conway
attributes.description_long: The late actor and comedian Tim Conway remembers an extended riff he had about two twin elephants during a rehearsal for "The Carol Burnett Show." This exclusive outtake is from American Masters – Carol Burnett: A Woman of Character (2007), directed by Kyra Thompson.

attributes.title: Remembering Jonas Mekas
attributes.description_long: Jonas Mekas, the influential filmmaker and co-founder of Anthology Film Archives and the New York Film-Makers' Cooperative, talks to director Timothy Greenfield-Sanders for Lou Reed: Rock and Roll Heart (1998) about his 1960s loft space in New York where Andy Warhol learned about experimental filmmaking. Mekas recalls tying Warhol to his seat during a six-hour screening of Sleep, and describes the

attributes.title: Remembering Stan Lee
attributes.description_short: Stan Lee and others discuss Lee’s influential work at Marvel Comics.
attributes.description_long: In interviews with American Masters Executive Producer Michael Kantor for Superheroes: A Never-Ending Battle, comic book legend Stan Lee and others discuss Lee’s influential work at Marvel Comics, co-creating “The Fantastic Four,” “The Incredible Hulk,” Spider-Man and more.

attributes.title: Remembering Paula Wayne
attributes.description_long: Paula Wayne starred alongside Sammy Davis, Jr., in the groundbreaking Broadway musical “Golden Boy” about a black boxer who falls for his manager's white girlfriend – they shared the first interracial kiss on a Broadway stage.

attributes.title: Artists Flight On-Air Promo
attributes.description_short: THIRTEEN’s American Masters Presents an “Artists Flight” Fridays.
attributes.description_long: Four documentaries explore the lives of iconic visual artists Eva Hesse, Elizabeth Murray, Andrew Wyeth and Jean-Michel Basquiat.

attributes.title: Artists Flight Series Promo
attributes.description_short: American Masters Presents an “Artists Flight” Fridays.
attributes.description_long: Four documentaries explore the lives of iconic visual artists Eva Hesse, Elizabeth Murray, Andrew Wyeth and Jean-Michel Basquiat.

attributes.title: Remembering Neil Simon
attributes.description_long:
Pulitzer Prize-winning playwright Neil Simon reflects on his fantasies and career while shooting a game of pool in Simply Simon: Not Just For Laughs
(1989).

attributes.title: 2018 Emmy Promo
attributes.description_short: Watch the 5 Outstanding Awards-Eligible American Masters documentaries from season 31-32.
attributes.description_long: American Masters celebrates all the incredible filmmakers, producers, directors and team members who brought us these inspirational documentaries.
